summary: This document is an email chain from January 2020, forwarding a September 2019 exchange between attorneys Brittany Henderson and Brad Edwards and an Assistant United States Attorney (AUSA) from the Southern District of New York. The AUSA requests emails and photographs related to a victim's encounters with Jeffrey Epstein, which Henderson and Edwards possess.

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.context: An attorney corresponding with Brad Edwards and an AUSA regarding the provision of documents and photographs related to a victim's encounters with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: An attorney who, along with Brittany Henderson, possesses emails and photographs related to a victim's encounters with Jeffrey Epstein and is coordinating their release to federal prosecutors.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the case; the document concerns emails and photographs related to a victim's encounters with him.

connections.description: Colleagues or legal partners working together on a case involving Jeffrey Epstein, coordinating the sharing of evidence with prosecutors.
Attorney providing evidence (emails, photographs) to a federal prosecutor investigating Jeffrey Epstein.
Attorney providing evidence (emails, photographs) to a federal prosecutor investigating Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: AUSA Request for Epstein Evidence
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney from the SDNY emails Brittany Henderson to request a batch of emails a victim provided relating to her encounters with Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Attorneys Provide Photographs
events.description: Brittany Henderson emails the AUSA, attaching two photographs of a victim from the relevant time period and confirming documents will be sent later.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Federal prosecutors from the Southern District of New York were actively gathering evidence (emails and photographs) from victims' attorneys in September 2019, months after Jeffrey Epstein's death.
Attorneys Brittany Henderson and Brad Edwards were in possession of a victim's emails and photographs related to her encounters with Jeffrey Epstein.
The document indicates a meeting occurred in California between prosecutors and a victim the week prior to September 23, 2019.
The correspondence shows ongoing cooperation between victims' civil attorneys and federal criminal investigators post-Epstein's death.
